intro: Cracca carpenteri, commonly known as Carpenter's cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, often growing in open woodlands or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
